Comment: The ambiguity around who is and is not DOGE starts with the fact that there are in fact two DOGEs: the [repurposed US Digital Service](https://www.wired.com/story/plaintext-trump-musk-us-digital-service-doge/), now known as the US DOGE Service, and a temporary organization within the US DOGE Service called, naturally, the US DOGE Service Temporary Organization, which is tasked with carrying out the DOGE agenda. In some cases, DOGE affiliates are hired directly into federal agencies. In other cases, they are detailed to those agencies temporarily.with staff: Who from the GSA worked for Elon Musk’s so-called Department of Government Efficiency? To Ehikian, the answer was far from straightforward. “D-O-G-E?” he asked, according to a video obtained by WIRED and sources with firsthand knowledge of the meeting. “You’re talking about DOGE?” Then he clarified: “There is no DOGE team inside of GSA.  Since Donald Trump retook the White House in January, people with ties to Elon Musk or his companies have popped up all over the federal government. Thomas Shedd, a former Tesla engineer, now [leads the Technology Transformation Services](https://www.wired.com/story/elon-musk-lieutenant-gsa-ai-agency/). Michael Grimes, an investment banker at Morgan Stanley who helped finance the Twitter deal, is now a senior advisor at the Commerce Department. Even Ehikian, while not a DOGE employee, is married to a former designer at Musk’s social media company X and has taken up the mantle of cost-cutting, targeting 50 percent reductions in spend across the GSA. All appear to be carrying out Trump's DOGE agenda, although they do not work for DOGE directly.  The GSA and the White House did not immediately respond to requests for comment from WIRED.  Read more: [https://www.wired.com/story/elon-musk-doge-mystery-general-services-administration/](https://www.wired.com/story/elon-musk-doge-mystery-general-services-administration/)
Author: wiredmagazine

Comment: DOGE was intended not to improve the govt. It's a play on words to drive interest in Musk's investment in crypto currency (of the same fucking name).
